root.pub-comments: This is a subtree of the unclassified language tree provided in Ethnologue. It has been broken into regions for ease of searching.
root.publications: Gordon, Raymond G. (ed.). 2005. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, 15 edn. http://www.ethnologue.com/15/web.asp. (09 July, 2008.)

child.geography: Peru: Puerto Elvira on Lake Vacacocha on the Napo River

child.geography: Brazil: Mato Grosso do Sul, near Corumbá
child.publications: Gordon, Raymond G. (ed.). 2005. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, 15 edn. http://www.ethnologue.com/15/web.asp. (09 July, 2008.)

child.geography: Venezuela: Central Venezuela. A northern group is in Bolivar Division on the Kaima River, a tributary of the Cuchivero River; an isolated southern group is in Amazonas on the Iguana, a tributary of the Asita River, and on the Parucito, a tributary of the Manapiare River.
child.alt-names: Yoana, Yuana, Waruwaru, Chicano, Chikano, Joti, Jodi, Hoti
child.publications: Gordon, Raymond G. (ed.). 2005. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, 15 edn. http://www.ethnologue.com/15/web.asp. (09 July, 2008.)

child.geography: Brazil: Pernambuco, Serra de Urubá (Arobá) near the city of Cimbres, Bahía.
child.publications: Gordon, Raymond G. (ed.). 2005. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, 15 edn. http://www.ethnologue.com/15/web.asp. (09 July, 2008.)

child.geography: Colombia: Amazonas Department, halfway between the San Bernardo and Pure rivers. 3 long houses, at leas
child.publications: Gordon, Raymond G. (ed.). 2005. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, 15 edn. http://www.ethnologue.com/15/web.asp. (09 July, 2008.)

child.geography: Brazil: Mato Grosso, Xingú Park, between the Curisevo and Culuene rivers, near the Kuikúro
child.publications: Gordon, Raymond G. (ed.). 2005. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, 15 edn. http://www.ethnologue.com/15/web.asp. (09 July, 2008.)

child.geography: Colombia: Yarí River, Caquetá Region, above El Capitán waterfalls near the Yarí River. About 50 years ago 140 of them migrated to the Apaporis River, and settled on the upper Vaupés River near Puerto Nare.
child.publications: Gordon, Raymond G. (ed.). 2005. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, 15 edn. http://www.ethnologue.com/15/web.asp. (09 July, 2008.)
